title.narrative: 008 ADOLESCENT GIRLS PARTICIPATION IN PRIMARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: '2020, effective mechanisms and plans at Woreda and school level implemented to increase girls' primary completion. Adolescent Girls' Participation in Primary Education (new): By 2020, effective mechanisms and plans at Woreda and school level implemented to increase girls' primary completion, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, equitable access created and quality education and training provided to all learners at pre-primary and primary level and girls' access to secondary education increased, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children, populations and localities

participating-org.narrative: B GUMUZ REGIONAL EDUCATION BUREAU REB

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: '2020, effective mechanisms and plans at Woreda and school level implemented to increase girls’ primary completion. Adolescent Girls’ Participation in Primary Education (new): By 2020, effective mechanisms and plans at Woreda and school level implemented to increase girls’ primary completion

description.narrative: UNICEF's supported evidence generation, systems strengthening and building capacity of key government staff to address girls' high dropout rates and low completion rates. A code of conduct code (CoC) to combat school related gender-based violence (SRGBV) was rolled out. School gender clubs were established to build girls' knowledge and skills in SRGBV. Gender Club Guidelines and life skills education manual for school adolescents were developed. A qualitative research on the implementation of the CoC was conducted. After COVID-19 induced school closures, Regional Education Bureaus adopted multiple distance education platforms, mainly radio and TV channels which benefitted girls. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Number of girls in primary education who participated in UNICEF supported skills development programmes for learning, personal empowerment and active citizenship

actual.value: 2020:29,850 A comprehensive life skills training manual is finalized. Its rolling out to schools to benefit adolescent girls is challenged by the disruption of the schools in the country since mid-March, 20202.

title.narrative: Education Sector Policy/Plan with quality prevention and response mechanisms to address gender based violence in and around schools
